results.title: Spirits from the past
results.creator_credit: Hugh Burnett and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at the claims that famous men and women from the past are still working creatively with people alive today. Three people speak about their experiences and beliefs, and claim to be in touch with dead musicians; receiving new music from many composers such as Liszt, Chopin, Beethoven, Brahms and Stravinsky.

results.title: A World of his own
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about 10 year old Matthew Ellis who is severely mentally retarded. Editor, Rod Adamson; camera, Tony Wilson.

results.title: As others see us: a look at interpersonal relations
results.creator_credit: Monte Young and Salenger Educational Media
results.brief_description: An animated film which examines self-image by feedback; exploring the reasons why people see us differently from how we see ourselves. Provides examples of how relationships can be improved by openness and how to obtain positive feedback to enhance effective communication and interpersonal relationships.

results.title: That our children will not die
results.brief_description: Nigeria has the highest death rate in the world. 90% of children die from preventable diseases - fever (malaria) convulsions, diarrhoea, vomiting, bronchopneumonia, measles and malnutrition. In mothers, the majority of deaths are related to pregnancy and child-bearing. Written in a feminist perspective, the film explores the subject of male dominance in the home and the re-education of both men and women in informed decision-making to help save children’s lives. The film also shows the primary health care services available in various parts of Nigeria which use specially trained community health workers in an expanded role. Discusses what needs to be the focus for any health-planning. Narrated by Professor O. Ransome-Kuti.

results.title: The Cadillac
results.creator_credit: Robert Clouse, Jerry Fitzgerald, Pete Rodriguez and Robert Clouse Associates
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the father in a Mexican-American family who wins a Cadillac car, forms grandiose plans for its use without regard to his inadequate income, makes himself unpopular by his over-solicitous care of the automobile, but is brought to his senses in a subtly worked out resolution. Uses still picture technique.

results.title: Steel
results.brief_description: A picture of the British steel industry showing all stages in the manufacture of steel from the mining of iron ore to the finished products ranging from small precision instruments to vast keels for ocean-going vessels.

results.title: Portrait of Paula
results.brief_description: Paula, an engineer in New York, talks about herself while photographs of her as a child, her family and her wedding are shown. Paula discusses her marriage and human relationships, equal opportunity, women in the work-force, problems of management and her other interests in art and sailing.

results.title: Maps we live by
results.brief_description: This is a film about the common language of maps, and the ways in which maps unite both the affairs and minds of men of all nations. It is an essay on the increasing interdependence of the nations of the world. This is not a technical film of instruction.

results.title: My financial career
results.creator_credit: Gerald Potterton, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon film from Stephen Leacock’s witty account of a young man’s first brush with banking. When he goes to make his deposit he is so overawed by the institution that nothing he intends to say comes out right. (Awards: Oscar nomination, Hollywood; San Francisco; New York)

results.title: The Lollipop opera by Don Freeman
results.brief_description: A lively film about a barber who draws his own shop, adds a “Mop Top” customer, then cuts and shampoos the boy’s unmanageable hair, finally rewarding him with a lollipop for his good behaviour. Rossini’s “Barber of Seville” provides a lively musical accompaniament. No dialogue. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
